txt.en: A great host of Orcs spilled through Ram Dúath, driving the Men of the North Downs from their farms. Esteldín, home of the few remaining Dúnedain of the North, was spared discovery. It is from there that the Rangers begin to plan their counter-offensive against the black tide of Angmar.

The goblins' numbers are great, and they are held to their duty by a ruthless taskmaster. The bond is a frail one, founded upon fear.\n\nYou should seek the goblin-camps on the outskirts of Dol Dínen and find this goblin-taskmaster. If he is slain, the will of the goblins may be broken.
The goblin-taskmaster Natkam patrols the goblin-camps on the outskirts of the Orc-host in Dol Dínen.\n\nYou should sever the thread that holds the goblins together: defeat Natkam, who leads them.
You have defeated Natkam, the leader of the goblins. Their forces will scatter without his brutal will forced upon them.
You have defeated Natkam, the leader of the goblins. Their forces will scatter without his brutal will forced upon them.
'If victory is to be ours, I fear it will be won in the South, not here. Nevertheless, we must persevere.'
'We are beaten before we have begun, but not yet crushed. For that, we have you to thank, [placeholder].'
The goblin-taskmaster Natkam patrols the goblin-camps on the outskirts of the Orc-host in Dol Dínen.\n\nYou should sever the thread that holds the goblins together: defeat Natkam, who leads them.
